Module opentdk.api
Package org.opentdk.api.datastorage

Class FilterRule

java.lang.Object
org.opentdk.api.datastorage.FilterRule
public class FilterRule
extends Object
This class is used to define rules that will be used for filtering DataSets from tabular data formats like DataContainer or in where and set conditions of SQL queries.

The following example defines the where condition of the SQL statement select * from customer where company = 'LK Test Solutions GmbH' and lastname = 'Meisinger' that can be used for the SQLStatement class to generate the statement: 
 SQLStatement stmnt = new SQLStatement(ESQL.COMMAND_SELECT);
 Filter fltr = new Filter()
 fltr.addFilterRule("company", "LK Test Solutions GmbH", EOperator.EQUALS, EOperator.AND);
 fltr.addFilterRule("lastname", "Meisinger", EOperator.EQUALS, EOperator.AND);
 stmnt.setConditionsFilter(fltr);
Author:
LK Test Solutions GmbH

  • Constructor Details

    • FilterRule

      public FilterRule​(String ruleStr)
      Constructor that is called when creating an instance of FilterRule with the full rule definition as String. This string will be parsed into the single rule elements like headerName, value, filterOperator and ruleConcatenationOperator and the properties of these elements will automatically be set with the identified values.

    • FilterRule

      public FilterRule​(String hName, String value)
      Constructor that is called when creating an instance of FilterRule with the arguments for header name and value. In this case EOperator.EQUALS will be used as default operator for checking the rule against a single value.
      Parameters:
      hName - String value with the Header name of the DataSet to which the rule applies.
      value - String value, used by the check operation of the FilterRule.

    • FilterRule

      public FilterRule​(String hName, String value, boolean quoteRuleString)

    • FilterRule

      public FilterRule​(String hName, String[] values)
      Constructor that is called when creating an instance of FilterRule with the arguments for header name and a values Array. In this case EOperator.EQUALS will be used as default operator for checking the rule against multiple values.
      Parameters:
      hName - String value with the Header name of the DataSet to which the rule applies.
      values - Array of Strings, used by the check operation of the FilterRule.

    • FilterRule

      public FilterRule​(String hName, String[] values, boolean quoteRuleString)

    • FilterRule

      public FilterRule​(String hName, String value, BaseDispatchComponent m) throws Exception
      Constructor that is called when creating an instance of FilterRule with the arguments for header name, value and operator. In this case any operator from the EOperator ENUM can be chosen for checking the rule against a single value.
      Parameters:
      hName - String value with the Header name of the DataSet to which the rule applies.
      value - String value, used by the check operation of the FilterRule.
      m - Value of type EOperator, used for the check operation.
      Throws:
      Exception - If any error occurs, it should be logged with the MLogger.

    • FilterRule

      public FilterRule​(String hName, String value, BaseDispatchComponent m, boolean quoteRuleString) throws Exception
      Throws:
      Exception

    • FilterRule

      public FilterRule​(String hName, String[] values, BaseDispatchComponent m) throws Exception
      Constructor that is called when creating an instance of FilterRule with the arguments for header name, values Array and operator. In this case any operator from the EOperator ENUM can be chosen for checking the rule against multiple values.
      Parameters:
      hName - String value with the Header name of the DataSet to which the rule applies.
      values - Array of Strings, used by the check operation of the FilterRule.
      m - Value of type EOperator, used for the check operation.
      Throws:
      Exception - If any error occurs, it should be logged with the MLogger.

    • FilterRule

      public FilterRule​(String hName, String[] values, BaseDispatchComponent m, boolean quoteRuleString) throws Exception
      Throws:
      Exception

    • FilterRule

      public FilterRule​(String hName, String value, BaseDispatchComponent m, BaseDispatchComponent concat) throws Exception
      Constructor that is called when creating an instance of FilterRule with the arguments for header name, value and operator. In this case any operator from the EOperator ENUM can be chosen for checking the rule against a single value.
      Parameters:
      hName - String value with the Header name of the DataSet to which the rule applies.
      value - String value, used by the check operation of the FilterRule.
      m - Value of type EOperator, used for the check operation.
      concat - Value of type EOperator, used for concatenating multiple filter conditions (e.g. EOperator.CONCATENATE_AND, EOperator.CONCATENATE_OR)
      Throws:
      Exception - If any error occurs, it should be logged with the MLogger.

    • FilterRule

      public FilterRule​(String hName, String value, BaseDispatchComponent m, BaseDispatchComponent concat, boolean quoteRuleString) throws Exception
      Throws:
      Exception

    • FilterRule

      public FilterRule​(String hName, String[] values, BaseDispatchComponent m, BaseDispatchComponent concat) throws Exception
      Constructor that is called when creating an instance of FilterRule with the arguments for header name, values Array and operator. In this case any operator from the EOperator ENUM can be chosen for checking the rule against multiple values.
      Parameters:
      hName - String value with the Header name of the DataSet to which the rule applies.
      values - Array of Strings, used by the check operation of the FilterRule.
      m - Value of type EOperator, used for the check operation.
      concat - The operator that gets used to add the rule string to the one before.
      Throws:
      Exception - If any error occurs, it should be logged with the MLogger.

    • FilterRule

      public FilterRule​(String hName, String[] values, BaseDispatchComponent m, BaseDispatchComponent concat, boolean quoteRuleString) throws Exception
      Throws:
      Exception

  • Method Details

    • getHeaderName

      public String getHeaderName()
      Get the value of the headerName property,
      Returns:
      Value of type string

    • getValue

      public String getValue()
      Get the value, used by check operation of the rule.
      Returns:
      Value of type string

    • getValues

      public Object[] getValues()
      Returns:
      the values Array, used by check operation of the rule.

    • getFilterOperator

      public BaseDispatchComponent getFilterOperator()
      Get the filterOperator attribute which is used for validation of the filtered values.
      Returns:
      filterOperator of type EOperator.

    • getRuleConcatenationOperator

      public BaseDispatchComponent getRuleConcatenationOperator()
      Get the ruleConcatenationOperator attribute which is used to concatenate multiple filter rules. Valid operators can be EOperator.AND and EOperator.OR.
      Returns:
      The Operator of type EOperator.

    • getRuleString

      public String getRuleString()
      Get the complete rule including ruleConcatenationOperator, headerName, filterOperator and value as String.
      e.g. "and company = 'LK Test Solutions GmbH'"
      Returns:
      complete rule as String

    • setRuleString

      public void setRuleString​(String ruleStr)
      Set the ruleString property with the complete rule including ruleConcatenationOperator, headerName, filterOperator and value.
      e.g. "and company = 'LK Test Solutions GmbH'"
      Parameters:
      ruleStr - Complete filter rule with all rule elements as String

    • assignRuleString

      public void assignRuleString()

    • assignRuleString

      public void assignRuleString​(boolean quoteRuleString)

    • checkValue

      public boolean checkValue​(String val)
      Checks, if the defined rule matches to a given value.
      Parameters:
      val - Value to check
      Returns:
      boolean value; true = rule matches to the defined value; false = rule doesn't match to the defined value.

    • isValidValue

      public boolean isValidValue​(String val, String filterValue)
      Calls the comparison operation for the rule and returns true (rule matches) or false (rule doesn't match).
      Parameters:
      val - Value of DataSet, where the rule will apply to
      filterValue - Value to compare with: defined in the filter rule
      Returns:
      boolean value; true = rule matches to the defined value; false = rule doesn't match to the defined value.

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(Object o)
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
